Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands near top of sherd; exterior: guilloche-style complex with triangles, circles and spikes; four-dot rosettes and rising corner roundel as filling ornament; to right, dividing band of two vertical lines and vertical key maeander pattern; below, in handle zone, simple guilloche pattern and tongue pattern near handle; below, single brown band above possible maeander.
Curator's comments: For the complex field ornament, see Lemos 1991, 66, fig. 40 (bottom right). For the broken cable pattern, see Lemos 1991, 90-1, fig. 47, no. 2.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 236, no. 159, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0148) (phase 2)
